tit.e: Ido-toge Pass (a pass in major local road in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City)
Ido-toge Pass (a pass in major local road in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City)

sen.j: 井戸峠（いどとうげ）は京都府京都市右京区にある主要地方道上の峠である。
sen.e: Ido-toge Pass is a pass on a major local road in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ido-toge Pass is a pass on a major local road in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ido-toge Pass is a pass on a major local road in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 標高430mの京都府京都市右京区京北上弓削町と同区京北井戸町を隔てる峠である。
sen.e: It is 430m above sea level and it forms a border between Keihoku-Kamiyuge-cho (Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture) and Keihoku-Ido-cho (Ukyo Ward).
It is the pass separating Keihoku-Kamiyuge-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City and Keihoku-Ido-cho, the same ward at an altitude of 430 meters.
It is the pass separating Keihoku-Kamiyuge-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City and Keihoku-Ido-cho, the same ward at an altitude of 430 meters.

sen.j: 京都府道61号京都京北線上に位置している。
sen.e: It is on Kyoto-Keihoku-sen Kyoto Prefectural Road 61.
It is located on Kyoto Prefectural Road 61 Kyoto-Keihoku Line.
It is located on Kyoto Prefectural Road 61 Kyoto-Keihoku Line.

sen.j: 古来その名が良く知られていた峠であり、落ち武者がこの峠を越えて、山の奥の初川集落に逃げ込んで生活していたとの伝説が残っている。
sen.e: Since ancient times the pass has been famous and a legend is connected with it: A swordsman, who had been defeated on battlefields, climbed the pass for his life and hid out in Hatsukawa Village, deep in the mountain.
Since ancient times the pass has been famous and a legend is remained that a defeated soldier fleeing the enemy climbed over the pass to Hatsukawa Settlement deep in the mountain and lived there.
Since ancient times the pass has been famous and a legend is remained that a defeated soldier fleeing the enemy climbed over the pass to Hatsukawa Settlement deep in the mountain and lived there.

sen.j: 車両の通行が可能な峠である。
sen.e: Normal cars can run through it.
Vehicles can run through it.
Vehicles can run through it.

sen.j: 峠から麓までアスファルトで舗装されており、道幅も1.8車線程度、狭窄しても1.5車線程度までにしかならないので、普通車同士の離合も十分可能である。
sen.e: The road is paved with asphalt from the foot to the peak, most parts are 1.8 lanes wide and the narrowest part still has 1.5 lanes wide, so normal cars can pass each other easily.
The road is paved with asphalt from the foot to the peak with 1.8 lanes wide, or still with 1.5 lanes wide in the narrowest part, so standard-sized cars can pass each other easily.
The road is paved with asphalt from the foot to the peak with 1.8 lanes wide, or still with 1.5 lanes wide in the narrowest part, so standard-sized cars can pass each other easily.

sen.j: 勾配はそれほど急ではないが、ブラインドカーブは多い。
sen.e: There aren't many steep slopes, however some sections' visibility are very poor because of the sharp bends.
While the inclination isn't so sharp, the road has many blind curves.
While the inclination isn't so sharp, the road has many blind curves.

sen.j: 冬季通行止めにならない路線上にあるので積雪時にも通行は可能だが、雪により道幅は狭まることはある。
sen.e: The pass is not closed for the winter, however the road become narrower when the snow is heaped up.
The road is not snowbound as it is on the route which isn't blocked in winter, the width sometimes become narrower by snow.
The road is not snowbound as it is on the route which isn't blocked in winter, the width sometimes become narrower by snow.

sen.e: National Highway 477 – Kyoto Prefectural Road 61 – Ido-toge Pass – National Highway 162
From National Route 477 through Kyoto Prefectural Road 61 and Ido-toge Pass to National Route 162.
